vulnerabilities.title: Session fixation in express-openid-connect
vulnerabilities.description:
### Overview

Versions `2.3.0` up to and including `2.5.1` do not regenerate the session id and session cookie when user logs in.  This behavior opens up the application to various session fixation vulnerabilities.

### Am I affected?
You are affected by this vulnerability if you are using `express-openid-connect` version `2.3.0` up to and including `2.5.1` and use a custom session store.


### How to fix that?
Upgrade to version `>= 2.5.2`.

### Will this update impact my users?
The fix provide

vulnerabilities.title: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect') in express-openid-connect
vulnerabilities.description:
### Impact
Users of the `requiresAuth` middleware, either directly or through the default `authRequired` option, are vulnerable to an Open Redirect when the middleware is applied to a catch all route.

If all routes under `example.com` are protected with the `requiresAuth` middleware, a visit to `http://example.com//google.com` will be redirected to `google.com` after login because the original url reported by the Express framework is not properly sanitised.

### Am I affected?
You are affected
